SEARCH
Package grafiosch.rest

Class UpdateCreate<T extends BaseID<Integer>>

java.lang.Object
grafiosch.rest.DailyLimitUpdCreateLogger<T>
grafiosch.rest.UpdateCreate<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the entity, which must extend BaseID.
Direct Known Subclasses:
GTNetConfigEntityResource, TransactionResource, UpdateCreateResource
public abstract class UpdateCreate<T extends BaseID<Integer>> extends DailyLimitUpdCreateLogger<T>
Abstract REST controller for creating and updating entities of type T. It handles common concerns such as:
  • JSON request/response handling.
  • User authentication and authorization.
  • Tenant-based and user-based data access control.
  • Entity validation.
  • Proposal mechanism for changes made by users without direct edit rights.
  • Daily limits for CRUD operations.
  • Audit logging for create, update, and delete operations.
Subclasses must implement getUpdateCreateJpaRepository() to provide the specific JPA repository for the entity type T.

    • updateSpecialEntity

      protected org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<T> updateSpecialEntity(User user, T entity) throws Exception
      Placeholder for special entity update logic. Subclasses can override this to implement custom update behavior for specific entity types not covered by the general logic.
      Parameters:
      user - The user performing the update.
      entity - The entity to be updated.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the updated entity or an error status.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs during the special update.
      UnsupportedOperationException - By default, if not overridden.

    • updateSaveEntity

      protected org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<T> updateSaveEntity(T entity, T existingEntity) throws Exception
      Saves the entity (either new or existing) to the repository. Only attributes marked with specified update property levels are saved.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity with new values.
      existingEntity - The existing entity from the database (can be null for new entities).
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the saved entity.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs during saving.

    • checkProposeChangeAndSave

      protected org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<T> checkProposeChangeAndSave(User user, T entity, Auditable parentEntity, boolean hasHigherPrivileges) throws Exception
      Checks if a proposal change is required or if the user has direct editing rights, then proceeds to save or propose the changes.
      Parameters:
      user - The user performing the operation.
      entity - The entity with new values.
      parentEntity - The auditable parent entity.
      hasHigherPrivileges - Flag indicating if the user has administrative or higher privileges.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the updated entity or the existing entity if a proposal was created.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs.

    • changeEntityWithPossibleProposals

      protected org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<T> changeEntityWithPossibleProposals(User userAtWork, T entity, T existingEntity) throws Exception
      Handles changes to an entity, including accepting existing proposals if applicable.
      Parameters:
      userAtWork - The user performing the change.
      entity - The entity with new values.
      existingEntity - The existing entity from the database.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the updated entity.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs.

    • createProposaleChange

      protected T createProposaleChange(T entity, T existingEntity, Auditable parentEntity) throws IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException, NoSuchMethodException
      Creates and saves a ProposeChangeEntity and its associated ProposeChangeFields based on the differences between the proposed entity and the existing entity.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity with the proposed changes.
      existingEntity - The current state of the entity in the database.
      parentEntity - The parent auditable entity, used to determine the owner of the original entity.
      Returns:
      The existing entity, as no direct changes are made to it in this step.
      Throws:
      IllegalAccessException
      InvocationTargetException
      NoSuchMethodException

    • hasRightsForEditingEntity

      protected boolean hasRightsForEditingEntity(User user, T newEntity, T existingEntity, Auditable parentEntity)
      Override this too over rule the standard rights on writing entities without proposals change.
      Parameters:
      user - The user attempting the edit.
      newEntity - The entity with new values.
      existingEntity - The existing entity from the database.
      parentEntity - The parent auditable entity.
      Returns:
      true if the user has rights to edit, false otherwise.

    • checkAndSetEntityWithTenant

      protected T checkAndSetEntityWithTenant(T entity, User user)
      Only for entities with a tenant id, that means private data. It checks that the entity has the right tenant or no tenant set. For an existing entity it will be loaded, checked and returned.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to check and set the tenant for.
      user - The currently authenticated user.
      Returns:
      The existing entity if found and tenant matches, or the input entity if new.
      Throws:
      SecurityException - If a security breach is detected (e.g., tenant mismatch).

    • checkAndSetEntityWithUser

      protected T checkAndSetEntityWithUser(T entity, User user)
      Certain entities have a relation with the user and not with the tenant. Therefore, this must be checked to ensure that it is not misused. The user ID in the security context must match the user ID of the entity.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to check and set the user for.
      user - The currently authenticated user.
      Returns:
      The existing entity if found and user ID matches, or the input entity if new.
      Throws:
      SecurityException - If a security breach is detected (e.g., user ID mismatch).

    • checkAndSetUserBaseIDWithUser

      public static void checkAndSetUserBaseIDWithUser(UserBaseID entity, User user)
      Utility method to check and set the user ID on a UserBaseID entity. If the entity already has a user ID, it verifies it against the provided user's ID. Otherwise, it sets the entity's user ID to the provided user's ID.
      Parameters:
      entity - The UserBaseID entity to check/modify.
      user - The user whose ID should be set or checked against.
      Throws:
      SecurityException - If the entity's user ID is already set and does not match the provided user's ID.
